title: Holy Oil
introduction: Holy Oil, or Olio Santo, is a staple in Italian cuisine, particularly in Tuscany, Abruzzo, and other central regions of Italy. This spicy oil is used to 'anoint' various soups and pastas, adding a fiery kick to your dish. It's made from dried chiles or peperoncino and extra-virgin olive oil. Be cautiousâ€”it's quite hot!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon crushed dried chiles or crushed red pepper
instructions: In a small glass bottle, combine the peppers and oil.
Store in a cool, dark place up to 3 months.
